title: Is a person who had a heart attack never allowed to run again? - Quora

response.answer_text: “Today, many doctors prescribe exercise for their patients who have had heart attacks. Any exercise regimen requires careful monitoring and medical supervision. But for many, exercise post-heart attack has been shown to improve quality of life and decrease the risk for another cardiac event.”(1) Links:- (1) Running After a Heart Attack (Published 2018)

Many doctors prescribe regular exercise to their patients who have had a heart attack though, it might need medical supervision. Some people may exercise under observation. Medical staff and devices will be monitoring the heart function while exercising and this will help the doctor prescribe your post-heart attack exercising routine in a better way. Source: nytimes
